subhead: Backed by 20,000 personnel, the US immigration police have ramped up high-profile raids across the country, often acting in disregard of the rights of those arrested.

Macron leads charge against Russia's shadow fleet
subhead: At a European Political Community summit in Denmark on Thursday, Emmanuel Macron announced an upcoming meeting of chiefs of staff from the 'coalition of the willing' group of Ukraine's allies, to establish 'disruption policies' against vessels that Moscow uses to evade sanctions.

title: France sees nationwide strikes against austerity measures
subhead: Over 200 towns and cities across France saw union-led protests, with at least 195,000 protesters rallying against austerity measures proposed in a draft budget bill, as well as calls for a wealth tax on ultra-rich households.

title: Madagascar's neglected youth, a government-created 'ticking time bomb'
subhead: The concentration of economic privileges among a small elite, whose interests intermingle with both the public and private sectors, has stifled the country's development. Each year, 400,000 young people enter the job market, most without any training.

title: Yohji Yamamoto, the wise warrior of fashion
subhead: For more than four decades, the Japanese fashion designer has continued to surprise with his radical creations. His austere and rebellious style appeals to a new generation of fans, including stars such as Offset, A$AP Rocky and Burna Boy. At 81, the tireless designer will unveil his new women's collection during Paris Fashion Week, on October 3.

title: Trump's tariff war persists, destabilizing global trade
subhead: Six months ago, on April 2, the president of the United States unveiled his 'reciprocal tariffs' on the rest of the world. Since then, Washington has wielded the threat of new taxes to pressure its partners.
